oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Woman helping a man working on a Nine Patch quilt

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Women; Quilts; Quilting; Men
Quilts; Quilting
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Unidentified woman assisting a man as he makes a Nine Patch quilt. A pair of needle-nose pliers and a pair of scissors are on the table in front of the man.

Nine Patch quilts date back to the 19th Century. The quilt consists of nine equal squares but can be arranged in numerous ways. It is a popular beginner's pattern and is found in many children's and doll quilts.
